column4: How do I view the files of another linux partition on the same computer?
`sudo fdisk -l`, find out what partition it is (/dev/sd*). Then 'sudo mount [/dev/sd*] [directory to mount to]'
SnowmanX11, thanks. As an aside, do you know why it is that sometimes the other partitions on this computer get mounted but usually they do not?
Dunno, but gnome-volume-manager handles auto-mounting in Ubuntu
what would be a directory I would want to mount to? "/"?
Usually the directory would be created in /media/   but some use /mnt/
I'm using "mount -t ext3 /dev/sda2 /media/" it spat "wrong fs type, bad option...." back at me.
'blkid [/dev/sd*] and see what FS type it is
it accepted the command, but it gave no output.
I know the type is ext3.
do 'sudo fdisk -l' again, and tell me what is in the 'System' column for the partition. It won't give any output for an extended partition, for example.
So which SDA are you trying to mount?
I think I want to mount sda2.
also, it said must specify the filesystem type.
/dev/sda2 is an extended partition. You can't mount those.
